eu_initiatives:
An agenda for the modernization of higher education. 
Our modern societies are characterised by their diversity and complexity, and we must actively work towards social inclusion to face the future challenges1. As highlighted in the Roadmap for this initiative, “Higher education could do more to tackle social divisions”. Aside from its role in innovation and high-skills, higher education has an important role as a model of what individuals can achieve. As such it must make sure everyone has an equal opportunity to participate in higher education and contribute to society to the best of their abilities. The more systematic inclusion in teachers’ curriculum of modules on inclusion would be a first step in ensuring a broader social inclusion in higher education.

goals__remit:
LMCI was founded as a not for profit organization (company limited by guarantee, LBG) under British Law in London, United Kingdom. 
 
The advancement of education is our mission, to help to reach the United Nations goal “Education for all”. 
 
We therefore express our clear commitment to the "2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development", adopted at the UN Summit in New York on 25 September 2015. 
 
Achieving inclusive and equitable quality education for all will require increasing efforts. 
  
To realize this aims we focuses on the provision of quality personal growth, vocational and professional development qualifications to those who must or prefer to study from a distance. 
 
We warmly welcome international students, especially from the Commonwealth. 
 
According to the United Nations Agenda, our group of Students include those who cannot visit a classroom because they live in remote areas, people with disabilities preventing travel, those who have a busy schedule and those whose commitments mean they cannot set aside regular hours for study. 
 
We therefore support access to distance education, especially for the disadvantaged. 
 
We rely on those who participate in our activities and benefit from them to want to help us make them available.  
 
We want everyone to be able to follow the teachings regardless of their financial circumstances and where they life. 
 
For this reason, we are committed to working with the relevant bodies of the United Nations in order to cultivate global exchange with other academic experts.
